009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import ij.plugin.filter.RankFilters;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianFilterSeparable;
017import imagingbook.common.util.parameters.DialogParameterBundle;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This is an implementation of the adaptive thresholder proposed by Niblack in [1].
022 * See Sec. 9.2.2 of [2] for a detailed description.
023 * It comes in three different version, depending on the type of local support region:
024 * </p>
025 * <ul>
026 * <li>{@link Box}: uses a rectangular (box-shaped) support region;</li> 
027 * <li>{@link Disk}: uses a circular (disk-shaped) support region (see [2], Alg. 9.8);</li> 
028 * <li>{@link Gauss}: uses a 2D isotropic Gaussian support region (see [2], Alg. 9.9 and Prog. 9.2).</li> 
029 * </ul>
030 * Note that {@link NiblackThresholder} itself is abstract and thus cannot be instantiated.
031 * <p>
032 * [1] W. Niblack. “An Introduction to Digital Image Processing”. Prentice-Hall (1986).
033 * <br>
034 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
035 * </p>
036 * 
037 * @author WB
038 * @version 2022/08/01
039 */
040public abstract class NiblackThresholder implements AdaptiveThresholder {
041        
042        public enum RegionType { Box, Disk, Gauss }
043        
044        /**
045         * Parameters for class {@link NiblackThresholder}.
046         */
047        public static class Parameters implements DialogParameterBundle {
048                
049                @DialogLabel("Radius")
050                public int radius = 15;
051                
052                @DialogLabel("kappa")
053                public double kappa = 0.30;
054                
055                @DialogLabel("d_min")
056                public int dMin = 5;
057                
058                @DialogLabel("Background mode")
059                public BackgroundMode bgMode = BackgroundMode.DARK;
060        }
061        
062        private final Parameters params;
063        FloatProcessor Imean;
064        FloatProcessor Isigma;
065
066        private NiblackThresholder() {
067                this(new Parameters());
068        }
069
070        private NiblackThresholder(Parameters params) {
071                super();
072                this.params = params;
073        }
074        
075        // method to be implemented by real sub-classes:
076        abstract void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int radius);
077        
078        @Override
079        public ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor I) {
080                final int M = I.getWidth();
081                final int N = I.getHeight();
082                makeMeanAndVariance(I, params.radius);
083                ByteProcessor Q = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
084                final double kappa = params.kappa;
085                final int dMin = params.dMin;
086                final boolean darkBg = (params.bgMode == BackgroundMode.DARK);
087                
088                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
089                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
090                                double sigma = Isigma.getf(u, v);
091                                double mu = Imean.getf(u, v);
092                                double diff = kappa * sigma + dMin;
093                                int q = (int) Math.rint((darkBg) ? mu + diff : mu - diff);
094                                if (q < 0)       q = 0;
095                                if (q > 255) q = 255;
096                                Q.set(u, v, q);
097                        }
098                }
099                return Q;
100        }
101        
102        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
103        
104        /**
105         * Static convenience method for creating a {@link NiblackThresholder} with
106         * a specific support region type.
107         * Note that {@link NiblackThresholder} itself is abstract and cannot be instantiated
108         * (see concrete sub-types {@link Box}, {@link Disk}, {@link Gauss}).
109         * 
110         * @param regType support region type
111         * @param params other parameters
112         * @return an instance of {@link NiblackThresholder}
113         */
114        public static NiblackThresholder create(RegionType regType, Parameters params) {
115                switch (regType) {
116                case Box :              return new NiblackThresholder.Box(params);
117                case Disk :     return new NiblackThresholder.Disk(params);
118                case Gauss : return new NiblackThresholder.Gauss(params);
119                default :               return null;
120                }
121        }
122        
123        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
124        
125        /**
126         * Implementation of Niblack's adaptive thresholder using a
127         * rectangular (box-shaped) support region 
128         * (concrete implementation of abstract class {@link NiblackThresholder}).
129         */
130        public static class Box extends NiblackThresholder {
131
132                /**
133                 * Constructor using default parameters.
134                 */
135                public Box() {
136                        super();
137                }
138                
139                /**
140                 * Constructor with specific parameters.
141                 * @param params parameters
142                 */
143                public Box(Parameters params) {
144                        super(params);
145                }
146
147                @Override
148                void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int radius) {
149                        int M = I.getWidth();
150                        int N = I.getHeight();
151                        Imean =  new FloatProcessor(M, N);
152                        Isigma =  new FloatProcessor(M, N);
153                        final int n = (radius + 1 + radius) * (radius + 1 + radius);
154
155                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
156                                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
157                                        long A = 0;     // sum of image values in support region
158                                        long B = 0;     // sum of squared image values in support region
159                                        for (int j = -radius; j <= radius; j++) {
160                                                for (int i = -radius; i <= radius; i++) {
161                                                        int p = getPaddedPixel(I, u + i, v + j); // this is slow!
162                                                        A = A + p;
163                                                        B = B + p * p;
164                                                }
165                                        }
166                                        Imean.setf(u, v, (float) A / n);
167                                        Isigma.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sqrt((B - (double) (A * A) / n) / n));
168                                }
169                        }
170                }
171                
172                // TODO: change to use an ImageAccessor!
173                private int getPaddedPixel(ByteProcessor bp, int u, int v) {
174                        final int w = bp.getWidth();
175                        final int h = bp.getHeight();
176                        if (u < 0)
177                                u = 0;
178                        else if (u >= w)
179                                u = w - 1;
180                        if (v < 0)
181                                v = 0;
182                        else if (v >= h)
183                                v = h - 1;
184                        return bp.get(u, v);
185                }
186                
187        }
188        
189        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
190        
191        /**
192         * Implementation of Niblack's adaptive thresholder using a
193         * circular (disk-shaped) support region 
194         * (concrete implementation of abstract class {@link NiblackThresholder}).
195         */
196        public static class Disk extends NiblackThresholder {
197                
198                /**
199                 * Constructor using default parameters.
200                 */
201                public Disk() {
202                        super();
203                }
204                
205                /**
206                 * Constructor with specific parameters.
207                 * @param params parameters
208                 */
209                public Disk(Parameters params) {
210                        super(params);
211                }
212
213                @Override
214                void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int radius) {
215                        FloatProcessor mean = (FloatProcessor) I.convertToFloat();
216                        FloatProcessor var =  (FloatProcessor) mean.duplicate();
217                        
218                        RankFilters rf = new RankFilters();
219                        rf.rank(mean, radius, RankFilters.MEAN);
220                        Imean = mean;
221                        
222                        rf.rank(var, radius, RankFilters.VARIANCE);
223                        var.sqrt();
224                        Isigma = var;
225                }
226        }
227        
228        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
229        
230        /**
231         * Implementation of Niblack's adaptive thresholder using a
232         * 2D Gaussian support region 
233         * (concrete implementation of abstract class {@link NiblackThresholder}).
234         */
235        public static class Gauss extends NiblackThresholder {
236                
237                /**
238                 * Constructor using default parameters.
239                 */
240                public Gauss() {
241                        super();
242                }
243                
244                /**
245                 * Constructor with specific parameters.
246                 * @param params parameters
247                 */
248                public Gauss(Parameters params) {
249                        super(params);
250                }
251                
252                @Override
253                void makeMeanAndVariance(ByteProcessor I, int r) {
254                        // //uses ImageJ's GaussianBlur
255                        // local variance over square of size (size + 1 + size)^2
256                        int M = I.getWidth();
257                        int N = I.getHeight();
258                        
259                        Imean = new FloatProcessor(M,N);
260                        Isigma = new FloatProcessor(M,N);
261
262                        FloatProcessor A = I.convertToFloatProcessor();
263                        FloatProcessor B = I.convertToFloatProcessor();
264                        B.sqr();
265                        
266                        double sigma = r * 0.6; // sigma of Gaussian filter should be approx. 0.6 of the disk's radius
267                        
268//                      GaussianBlur gb = new GaussianBlur();
269//                      gb.blurFloat(A, sigma, sigma, 0.002);
270//                      gb.blurFloat(B, sigma, sigma, 0.002);
271                        
272                        GenericFilter gaussian = new GaussianFilterSeparable(sigma);
273                        gaussian.applyTo(A);
274                        gaussian.applyTo(B);
275
276                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
277                                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
278                                        float a = A.getf(u, v);
279                                        float b = B.getf(u, v);
280                                        float sigmaG = (float) Math.sqrt(b - a * a);
281                                        Imean.setf(u, v, a);
282                                        Isigma.setf(u, v, sigmaG);
283                                }
284                        }
285                }
286        }
287        
288}
